node.body:
### About the project

IndieWeb/microformats2 friendly blogging starter kit. Batteries packed.

**Link**: https://github.com/MaybeThisIsRu/smix-eleventy-starter

### Why I need help

 I don't use Eleventy any more.

### Skills required

Be running their own Eleventy site. Be aware of the updates happening in that ecosystem. Microformats2 knowledge is beneficial but not necessary.

### How to get in touch

hello@rusingh.com

### Meta Information (Please fill out)

- [x] I have read the [FAQ section](https://seeking-maintainers.net/faq) and confirm that my project is eligible to be added to the list
- [x] The title of this issue only displays the name of my project
- [x] I have filled out the code snippet below

```yaml
# A link to the code repository or homepage of the project
url: "https://github.com/MaybeThisIsRu/smix-eleventy-starter"

# A short description of your project. The description text of your GitHub repo might fit here nicely
description: "A standards-respecting starter kit for Eleventy. Go Indie."

# Some comma separated tags that describe your project (not yet implemented, but coming soon!)
tags: [eleventy, starter-kit, microformats2, indieweb]
```
node.title: Smix Eleventy Starter

node.body:
### About the project

<!-- A description about your project. What does it do? Why did you build it? -->

The spring-hibernate-query-utils project was built to help Spring developers detect and fix Hibernate N+1 Queries.
It was used in several projects I worked on and are still used actively by former colleagues.

<!-- Please also add a link to your page or repo, so that people can quickly take a look at the project -->
**Link**:  [spring-hibernate-query-utils](https://github.com/yannbriancon/spring-hibernate-query-utils)

### Why I need help

<!-- Why are you looking for new maintainers? Are you stressed out? Do you want to hand the project off entirely? -->

It has been several years I did not use Spring or Java and I have lost touch with latest releases and developments.

Several users asked me to update the library and integrate new features but I am dedicated to other projects.
I would love to see several people take over and improve the library, if it is still relevant.

### Skills required

<!-- What skills do potential maintainers need to help you out? -->

Skills in Spring, SQL and basic understanding of underlying Hibernate machinery.

No need for a very deep experience, the concepts are pretty basic.

### How to get in touch

<!-- How do you want potential maintainers to reach out? This might be your e-mail address, a chat room or a comment on this issue -->

Comment on this issue.

### Meta Information (Please fill out)

- [x] I have read the [FAQ section](https://seeking-maintainers.net/faq) and confirm that my project is eligible to be added to the list
- [x] The title of this issue only displays the name of my project
- [x] I have filled out the code snippet below

```yaml
# A link to the code repository or homepage of the project
url: "[https://github.com/yannbriancon/spring-hibernate-query-utils](https://github.com/yannbriancon/spring-hibernate-query-utils)"

# A short description of your project. The description text of your GitHub repo might fit here nicely
description: "Spring Hibernate Query Utils: an easy way of detecting N+1 queries and counting queries in a Spring/Hibernate application"

# Some comma separated tags that describe your project (not yet implemented, but coming soon!)
tags: [spring, hibernate, n-plus-one, sql, performance]
```
node.title: spring-hibernate-query-utils

node.body:
### About the project
I'm not the maintainer just a user that's trying to help recruit since I don't have the skills to be a maintainer. Objection.js is an [ORM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object-relational_mapping) for [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/) that aims to stay out of your way and make it as easy as possible to use the full power of SQL and the underlying database engine while still making the common stuff easy and enjoyable. 

**Link**: https://github.com/Vincit/objection.js

### Why I need help

<!-- Why are you looking for new maintainers? Are you stressed out? Do you want to hand the project off entirely? -->

### Skills required
I don't know everything involved so this is my informed guess haha
- JavaScript
- TypeScript
- ORM
- SQL

### How to get in touch
Probably by commenting on this issue and tagging the current maintainer (will probably change in the future so keep an eye on latest in the thread): https://github.com/Vincit/objection.js/issues/2335

### Meta Information (Please fill out)

- [x] I have read the [FAQ section](https://seeking-maintainers.net/faq) and confirm that my project is eligible to be added to the list
- [x] The title of this issue only displays the name of my project
- [x] I have filled out the code snippet below

```yaml
# A link to the code repository or homepage of the project
url: "https://github.com/Vincit/objection.js"

# A short description of your project. The description text of your GitHub repo might fit here nicely
description: "Objection.js is an ORM for Node.js that aims to stay out of your way and make it as easy as possible to use the full power of SQL and the underlying database engine while still making the common stuff easy and enjoyable."

# Some comma separated tags that describe your project (not yet implemented, but coming soon!)
tags: [ORM, JS, JavaScript]
```
node.title: Objection.js

node.body:
### About the project

Lunatic is a universal runtime for fast, robust and scalable server-side applications. It's inspired by Erlang and can be used from any language that compiles to [WebAssembly](https://webassembly.org/).

https://lunatic.solutions/
[Youtube: Conference Demonstration](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HdWEA_erA6w
)
### Why I need help

The project is unmaintained. 

The developer does still respond, and finds currently not enough time to maintain it.

### Skills required

Rust 

### How to get in touch

https://discord.com/invite/b7zDqpXpB4

### Meta Information (Please fill out)

node.body:
### About the project

<!-- A description about your project. What does it do? Why did you build it? -->

[gpodder.net](https://gpodder.net/) is a web service to manage your podcast subscriptions via the web. You can synchronize your devices, view status information and discover new interesting podcasts online.

<!-- Please also add a link to your page or repo, so that people can quickly take a look at the project -->
**Link**: https://github.com/gpodder/mygpo

### Why I need help

<!-- Why are you looking for new maintainers? Are you stressed out? Do you want to hand the project off entirely? -->

This project was lovingly maintained by its original author for over 10 years. It was handed off to the community who have tried to keep it running over the past few years. We'd love to smooth out some of the rough edges and continue to provide this great service to podcast lovers all around the world!

### Skills required

<!-- What skills do potential maintainers need to help you out? -->

Django (and Python, of course)
PostgreSQL
Redis
REST API
Ubuntu Linux
HTML/CSS
Transifex (for translations)

### How to get in touch

<!-- How do you want potential maintainers to reach out? This might be your e-mail address, a chat room or a comment on this issue -->

The best place to start is our contributor page: https://gpodder.net/contribute/

### Meta Information (Please fill out)

- [X] I have read the [FAQ section](https://seeking-maintainers.net/faq) and confirm that my project is eligible to be added to the list
- [X] The title of this issue only displays the name of my project
- [X] I have filled out the code snippet below

```yaml
# A link to the code repository or homepage of the project
url: "https://github.com/gpodder/mygpo"

# A short description of your project. The description text of your GitHub repo might fit here nicely
description: "gpodder.net is a web service to manage your podcast subscriptions via the web. You can synchronize your devices, view status information and discover new interesting podcasts online."

# Some comma separated tags that describe your project (not yet implemented, but coming soon!)
tags: [django, python, webservice, rest-api, podcast]
```
node.title: gpodder.net

node.body:
### About the project

Portable-VirtualBox is a free and open-source software tool that lets you run any operating system from a USB stick without installing separate software (runs VirtualBox from the USB stick or network drive, etc.).

Link: https://www.vbox.me/

### Why I need help

Unfortunately, I now have less time for open-source software development than I used to. There are also outstanding bugs that I have been unable to fix, so new eyes on thus bugs would be much appreciated.

### Skills required

General coding skills and prior experience making desktop software for Windows. Portable-VirtualBox is written in AutoIt, but prior experience is probably now necessary if you are willing to spend some time learning it. I did not know AutoIt when I did take over the project.

### How to get in touch

runarb [at] gmail [dot] com

### Meta Information (Please fill out)

- [X] I have read the [FAQ section](https://seeking-maintainers.net/faq) and confirm that my project is eligible to be added to the list
- [X] The title of this issue only displays the name of my project
- [X] I have filled out the code snippet below

```yaml
# A link to the code repository or homepage of the project
url: "https://www.vbox.me/"

# A short description of your project. The description text of your GitHub repo might fit here nicely
description: "Portable-VirtualBox is a free and open source software tool that lets you run any operating system from a usb stick without separate installation."

# Some comma separated tags that describe your project (not yet implemented, but coming soon!)
tags: [VirtualBox, Windows, AutoIt]
```
node.title: Portable-VirtualBox
